item.title: New Brunswick reports two new deaths related to COVID-19, 68 new cases on Tuesday
item.description: Health officials in New Brunswick are reporting 68 new cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, along with 86 recoveries, as the total number of active cases in the province drops to 632.
item.dc:creator: Allan April

item.title: Nova Scotia reports 97th COVID-19 related death, 32 new cases on Tuesday
item.description: Health officials in Nova Scotia are reporting the province's 97th COVID-19 related death, as well as 32 new cases and 28 recoveries, as 205 active cases remain in the province.
item.dc:creator: Allan April

item.title: N.S. to release daily details on schools affected by COVID-19 starting Tuesday
item.description: Elizabeth Guitard kept her kids home from school Monday, concerned over the growing list of COVID-19 exposures linked to Nova Scotia schools.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Petracek
item.enclosure: According to one parent, at least one school affected by multiple exposures is now taking extra measures. One parent whose child attends Halifax West says she received four separate notifications about cases connected to the school.

item.title: Stop asking staff to write fake vaccine records: New Brunswick Horizon Health
item.description: Horizon Health in New Brunswick has issued a notice telling residents to stop asking public health to falsify vaccination documentation.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Long
item.enclosure: Horizon Health in New Brunswick has issued a notice telling the public to stop asking public health to falsify vaccination documentation.

item.title: Plane lands in lake near Halifax airport after experiencing electrical issues
item.description: Emergency crews in Nova Scotia are on scene near the Halifax Stanfield International Airport after a plane landed in a lake.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Long
item.enclosure: Emergency crews in Nova Scotia are on scene near the Halifax Stanfield International Airport after a plane landed in a lake.

item.title: P.E.I. reports two new cases of COVID-19 Tuesday, active cases drop to nine
item.description: Prince Edward Island is reporting two new cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, as the active number of cases in the province drops to nine.
item.dc:creator: Allan April
item.enclosure: “Since August, 87 per cent of the cases in P.E.I. have been identified as the Delta variant,” said Dr. Heather Morrison, P.E.I.’s Chief Public Health Officer, during Tuesday’s news update.

item.title: Stalling weather pattern brings damp week; Hurricane Sam moves north
item.description: There will be varied weather conditions this week, including periods of rain and showers, as a number of slow moving weather systems move into the Maritimes.
item.dc:creator: Kalin Mitchell
item.enclosure: Varied weather conditions this week including periods of rain and showers as a number of slow moving weather systems move into the Maritimes. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darren Calabrese)

item.title: 'Flames were shooting through the roof': Early morning fire leaves one person dead in New Waterford, N.S.
item.description: Miner Avenue in New Waterford, N.S. was blocked with fire trucks Tuesday morning as crews worked to extinguish a fire in a small apartment complex.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Moore

item.title: RCMP end search for two Labrador fishermen reported missing more than a week ago
item.description: The RCMP in southeastern Labrador have called off the search for two fishermen whose boat disappeared more than a week ago.
item.dc:creator: The Canadian Press
item.enclosure: The fishing vessel Island Lady is shown in this undated handout image provided by Dwight Russell. The father of a missing fisherman is asking the coast guard to resume a full search effort in hopes of recovering his son and one crew member of a nine-metre boat that went missing on Friday off the coast of Labrador. THE CANADIAN PRESS/HO-Dwight Russell

item.title: New Brunswick coroner's inquest into 2020 police killing of Rodney Levi begins
item.description: The coroner’s inquest into the death of a man from New Brunswick's Metepenagiag First Nation began in Miramichi on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Eilish Bonang
item.enclosure: Rodney Levi pictured in an undated photo (Facebook)
